long_description: Loaded with Harshmellow tech for easy turns and vibration damping, the K2 Eco Lite snowboard delivers a fast and free feel for your maximum pleasure all over the mountain. Harshmellow technology employs a thin layer of synthetic polymer to damp the vibrations experienced while riding at high speeds. All-Terrain rocker is designed for use all over the mountain; it allows effortless turning on hardpack but also provides ample float in softer snow and crud. Tweekend baseline profile features a flat base between the feet and a rockered tip for a great feel when sliding rails, landing jumps and carving powder. Directional twin shape provides plenty of overall float and control, offering a balanced ride that's equally versatile ridden regular or switch. Hyper Progressive sidecut mellows out the transitions, leaving you with a predictable, all-around board; make ultrafine adjustments at any speed and in all conditions. Hybrilight construction minimizes the overall amount of materials used to unleash lightweight precision, powerful response and buttery-smooth performance. WH3 wood core features two strips of Honeykomb material between the bindings and rails for a fine-tuned response. Directional fiberglass laminates add torsional stiffness for improved edge hold and increased stability in off-axis landings. Carbon webs near binding area maximize ollie pop and control in all situations. Sintered base has the highest molecular weight available for fast and durable rides; plus, it retains wax longer for consistent performance. .
